properties.tree_description:
None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Repeated utility topping; loss of apical dominance with multiple codominant scaffold attachments; regrowth originating from prior heading cuts; visible decay present at several former heading cuts with associated woundwood development; potential for weaker branch attachment at regrowth points; cyclic reduction pattern likely to continue; size per survey
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:Crapemyrtle Tree Size (DBH):20Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Multi-stem; repeated topping (approx. 3–4 cycles); decay on two stems; cumulative size of three largest trunks
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Crapemyrtle Tree Size (DBH):15Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Repeated topping (~4 events); bowl regrowth structure; cumulative size of three largest trunks
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:Cjhinese Holly Tree Size (DBH):15Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Cumulative size 14.5 (7.5/7.0); undesired species; lean >20°; off-balance canopy
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:Beech Tree Size (DBH):26Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Upper canopy lean documented at 23°; growing within approximately 6 ft of adjacent Beech (Tree 1, approved under BA-202600382) with deformed and interdependent structural root plate (SRP) development; SRP deformation field estimated in excess of 30%; adjacent tree is larger in diameter and likely established earlier, suggesting dominant root plate influence and reduced independent anchorage on this tree; root plate reduction is observed on the tension side opposite the off-balance canopy, increasing structural relevance; off-balance canopy architecture; evidence of prior upper canopy breakout with subsequent re-growth; overall condition considered fair under current shared root and canopy conditions; upon removal of Tree 1, condition is expected to decline due to loss of shared buffering and altered load distribution; removal request is based on this projected change in structural condition
		
		
			Tree number:7Species:Chinese Privet Tree Size (DBH):9Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Multi-stem; invasive undesired species; size estimated
		
		
			Tree number:8Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):26Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Fusiform canker located high in the canopy on the main leader; canker fully encircling the leader with associated stem deformation and a visible, deteriorated cavity; evidence of active resin pitching observed; leader exhibits lean; defect is positioned along the primary structural load path
		
		
			Tree number:9Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):26Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Multiple small galls visible on the upper bole from the front elevation; however, one dominant defect in the upper leader presents differently, consistent with a fusiform canker complex. The primary defect appears encircled by fusiform rust with outer margins that are indented and undercut into the stem, creating a depressed central area with surrounding wood deformation. This defect is located on a primary leader carrying significant load and is visually observable from the right front of the residence using binocular or visual aids.
